headline.main: THE SANDWICH ISLANDS.; RAVAGES OF THE SMALL-POX. THE EXCITEMENT AGAINST THE MINISTRY. INTERESTING INTELLIGENCE.

docs.lead_paragraph: For the last two months, the principal topic of Sandwich Island conversation, with both native and foreigner, has been small-pox and its ravages. Since early in May, the disease has been among us, accelerating the already existing decrease of population, and destined, perhaps, in its results, to make a chapter of some importance in the histery of this group. byline.original: SPECIAL CORRESPONDENCE OF THE N.Y. DAILY TIMES.MES

docs.lead_paragraph: The future of Texas was never more hopeful than at present. An abundant crop of all the products of the country has been realized, and all the supplies of the farmers are commanding remunerating prices. With the exception of a few places on and near the sea coast, which have been visited by yellow fever, the health of the State has been, as usual, quite good.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

headline.main: THE POLICE.; Character, Duties, and Pay of Policemen.

NEW-YORK CITY.; MISSIONARY DEMONSTRATION. Methodists in Metropolitan Hall. Large Meeting of Sunday-School Children. MEDICAL. The Academy of Medicine. NEW-YORK STATE MILITIA. REVIEW OF SECOND BRIGADE. Dinner at the Irving House.

docs.lead_paragraph: Two meetings were held in Metropolitan Hall yesterday, under the direction of the young men of the M. E. Church, pursuant to the following notice: A Missionary demonstration will be given at Metropolitan Hall, on the afternoon and evening of Wednesday, November 2, under the direction of the Young Men of the M. E Church in this City.

docs.lead_paragraph: A short time since, a class of people known as "bar-keepers" discovered, or pretended to discover, that they were not realizing sufficient profits from the sale of certain liquors. Selling, as they almost universally do, doctored brandy, and heightening its intrinsic poison by chemical additions, they based their movement on the assertion that it was impossible for them to sell pure brandy, and live by its sale, at the rate six cents a glass.

headline.main: The Falcon at New-Orleans--Health of Mobile.
Destructive Fire at Louisville--Late and Interesting from the Plains.

docs.lead_paragraph: A fire broke out this morning on Main, between Third and Fourth-streets, consuming the grocery more of Mr. BUSTARD, and realty damaging BOST'S tobacco factory and HOUSE's Telegraph office. Loss not yet aecertained.
